Questions.Text: Emma has 12 apples. Her friend gave her 8 more apples. How many apples does Emma have now?
There are 15 kids playing in the park. 10 more kids joined them. How many kids are playing in the park now?
Tom has 5 toy cars. His mom bought him 9 additional toy cars. How many toy cars does Tom have in total?
Lucy collected 18 seashells at the beach. She found 7 more seashells later. How many seashells does she have altogether?
A farmer has 22 chickens. He buys 11 more chickens. How many chickens does he have now?
A toy store has 30 dolls. They received a shipment of 15 new dolls. How many dolls are in the store now?
Sarah has 9 balloons. Her friend gave her 6 more balloons. How many balloons does Sarah have now?
James read 14 books last month. This month, he read 8 more books. How many books has he read in total?
There are 25 students in the classroom. 10 more students joined the class. How many students are there now?
Anna has 16 stickers. She buys 9 more stickers. How many stickers does Anna have altogether?
A pet shop has 40 fish. They received 20 more fish from a supplier. How many fish are in the shop now?
Mark has 13 books on his shelf. His friend gave him 5 more books. How many books does Mark have now?
There are 21 cookies in a jar. Mom baked 9 more cookies. How many cookies are there in total?
A gardener planted 15 flowers in the morning and 10 more in the evening. How many flowers were planted in total?
Nina has 7 toy robots. She received 12 more robots for her birthday. How many toy robots does she have now?
A bakery sold 17 loaves of bread in the morning and 13 loaves in the afternoon. How many loaves of bread were sold in total?
Sophia has 20 crayons. Her friend gave her 15 more crayons. How many crayons does Sophia have now?
There are 9 birds in a tree. 4 more birds flew to the tree. How many birds are in the tree now?
A library has 50 new books. They received 25 more books as a donation. How many books does the library have now?
Leo has 30 marbles. He found 10 more marbles under his bed. How many marbles does Leo have now?
A farmer harvested 18 apples in the morning and 12 apples in the afternoon. How many apples did he harvest in total?
Mia has 4 puppies. She adopts 6 more puppies from the shelter. How many puppies does Mia have now?
A candy jar has 11 candies. After a party, there are 14 more candies added. How many candies are in the jar now?
Kevin has 26 toy blocks. He received 14 more blocks as a gift. How many toy blocks does Kevin have now?
Emma had 25 candies. She gave 8 candies to her friend. How many candies does she have left?
There are 40 apples in a basket. If 15 apples are taken out, how many apples remain in the basket?
Liam has 50 toy cars. He lost 12 of them while playing. How many toy cars does he still have?
Sophie read 30 pages of a book. If the book has 60 pages, how many pages does she have left to read?
In a classroom, there are 45 students. If 10 students go home early, how many students are left in the classroom?
Jack had 70 marbles. He gave away 20 marbles to his friends. How many marbles does Jack have now?
A farmer has 90 chickens. If 25 chickens are sold, how many chickens does the farmer have left?
There are 60 stickers in a book. If Mia uses 22 stickers for her project, how many stickers are left?
A library has 80 books. If 15 books are checked out, how many books are still in the library?
Tom had 55 points in a game. He lost 18 points in the next round. How many points does Tom have now?
Sara collected 72 shells at the beach. If she gave 30 shells to her brother, how many does she have left?
There are 100 balloons at a party. If 45 balloons pop, how many balloons are left?
A pet store has 25 puppies. If 7 puppies are adopted, how many puppies remain at the store?
Maya had 65 stickers in her collection. She traded 20 stickers with her friend. How many stickers does she have now?
A cake was cut into 50 pieces. If 18 pieces were eaten, how many pieces are left?
There are 78 cookies in a jar. If 29 cookies are taken out, how many cookies are remaining?
Lucy has 44 crayons. If she loses 16 crayons, how many crayons does she have left?
A gardener planted 90 flowers. If 35 flowers died, how many flowers are still alive?
Ben had 36 baseball cards. He gave 15 to his friend. How many baseball cards does he have left?
A zoo has 80 animals. If 22 animals are taken to another zoo, how many animals are left?
A box contains 52 chocolates. If 19 chocolates are eaten, how many chocolates are remaining in the box?
There are 66 players in a tournament. If 24 players are eliminated, how many players are still in the tournament?
A teacher had 48 markers. If 17 markers were broken, how many markers are still usable?
A pet shop had 30 kittens. If 12 kittens were adopted, how many kittens are left?
If there are 4 bags and each bag has 6 apples, how many apples are there in total?
A box has 7 rows of crayons, and each row has 5 crayons. How many crayons are there in total?
There are 9 kids in a class, and each kid has 3 toys. How many toys are there altogether?
If there are 8 flowers in each garden and there are 4 gardens, how many flowers are there in total?
A baker made 5 trays of cookies with 12 cookies on each tray. How many cookies did he make?
If each pack of stickers has 10 stickers and you have 3 packs, how many stickers do you have?
There are 6 packs of gum, and each pack contains 8 pieces. How many pieces of gum are there in total?
A toy store has 7 shelves, and each shelf holds 9 stuffed animals. How many stuffed animals are there in total?
If a classroom has 5 tables and each table has 4 chairs, how many chairs are there in total?
If there are 3 dogs and each dog has 4 bones, how many bones are there in total?
A farmer has 6 baskets and puts 10 oranges in each basket. How many oranges does he have?
If there are 4 teams and each team has 11 players, how many players are there in total?
A pack of cards has 13 cards in it. If you have 5 packs, how many cards do you have?
If there are 12 cupcakes in each box and you have 3 boxes, how many cupcakes do you have?
A school has 9 classrooms and each classroom has 8 desks. How many desks are there in total?
If each of the 10 friends has 2 balloons, how many balloons do they have together?
A restaurant has 4 tables, and each table has 6 chairs. How many chairs are there in total?
If a pet shop has 3 cages and each cage has 5 rabbits, how many rabbits are there?
There are 10 pizza slices in each pizza. If you order 4 pizzas, how many slices do you have?
A toy factory makes 7 dolls every hour. How many dolls does it make in 6 hours?
If a garden has 8 rows of flowers and each row has 9 flowers, how many flowers are there?
If you collect 5 stickers each day for 10 days, how many stickers do you collect?
A box of chocolates contains 15 chocolates. If you have 2 boxes, how many chocolates do you have?
If there are 6 cars and each car has 4 wheels, how many wheels are there in total?
There are 24 apples and 6 baskets. If you want to put the apples evenly in the baskets, how many apples will go in each basket?
A teacher has 30 pencils and wants to distribute them equally among 5 students. How many pencils will each student get?
There are 48 cookies and 8 plates. If you put the cookies evenly on the plates, how many cookies will be on each plate?
Sarah has 36 stickers and she wants to share them equally with her 9 friends. How many stickers will each friend get?
A farmer has 50 oranges and he wants to pack them into boxes that hold 10 oranges each. How many boxes does he need?
There are 80 marbles and 8 kids want to play with them. If they share the marbles equally, how many marbles does each kid get?
A bakery made 56 muffins and they want to pack them into boxes of 7 muffins each. How many boxes will they fill?
Tom has 18 toy cars and he wants to give them to 3 of his friends. If he gives the same number of cars to each friend, how many cars will each friend receive?
In a class, there are 45 books and 9 students. If the books are shared equally among the students, how many books does each student get?
A gardener has 72 flowers and wants to plant them in rows of 8 flowers each. How many rows can he plant?
There are 60 cupcakes and 10 boxes. If the cupcakes are divided equally among the boxes, how many cupcakes will be in each box?
A zoo has 84 animals and 12 enclosures. If they want to put the animals evenly in the enclosures, how many animals will go in each enclosure?
There are 27 students and 3 groups for a project. If the students are divided equally into groups, how many students will be in each group?
A toy store has 90 toys and they want to display them in 10 equal sections. How many toys will go in each section?
Lily has 40 crayons and wants to share them with 5 of her friends. How many crayons does each friend get?
A pizza shop made 36 slices of pizza and 6 customers are there. If they share the slices equally, how many slices will each customer get?
In a library, there are 54 books and 9 shelves. If the books are arranged equally on the shelves, how many books will go on each shelf?
A toy maker has 64 toy blocks and wants to pack them into boxes of 8 blocks each. How many boxes can he fill?
A group of 12 kids wants to play with 60 balloons. If they share the balloons equally, how many balloons does each kid get?
A farmer collected 90 eggs and wants to pack them in cartons of 10 eggs each. How many cartons does he need?
There are 36 pieces of candy and 4 friends want to share them equally. How many pieces of candy will each friend get?
A class has 56 crayons and they want to distribute them to 7 tables. How many crayons will each table get?
A fish tank has 45 fish and 5 tanks. If the fish are divided equally among the tanks, how many fish will be in each tank?
A school has 18 basketballs and 6 teams. If they share the basketballs equally, how many basketballs does each team get?
